evaluators.name: Latent Space Evaluator
evaluators.description: Evaluates latent space quality for single-cell data, designed for trajectory and steady-state data analysis.

metrics.name: Manifold Dimensionality Score
metrics.description: Evaluates how efficiently the latent space captures the intrinsic dimensionality using variance thresholds, Kaiser criterion, elbow method, and spectral decay.
metrics.interpretation: Higher indicates more efficient dimension usage

metrics.name: Spectral Decay Rate
metrics.description: Measures how quickly eigenvalues decay. Fast decay means information is concentrated in fewer dimensions.
metrics.interpretation: Higher indicates information concentration in primary dimensions

metrics.name: Participation Ratio Score
metrics.description: Quantifies how many dimensions effectively participate in the variance. Based on the ratio of squared sum to sum of squares of eigenvalues.

metrics.name: Isotropy/Anisotropy Score
metrics.description: Measures directional uniformity using log-ellipticity, condition numbers, ratio variance, entropy, primary dominance, and effective dimension.
metrics.interpretation: Trajectory: high anisotropy (strong direction). Steady-state: high isotropy (uniform)

metrics.name: Trajectory Directionality Score
metrics.description: Evaluates the dominance of the primary developmental axis by comparing the first principal component's variance to others.
metrics.interpretation: Higher indicates a clear developmental trajectory

metrics.name: Noise Resilience Score
metrics.description: Evaluates how well the dimensionality reduction filters technical noise by computing signal-to-noise ratio from principal components.

evaluators.name: Dimensionality Reduction Evaluator
evaluators.description: Evaluates dimensionality reduction quality by measuring structure preservation between high and low dimensional spaces.

metrics.name: Distance Correlation
metrics.description: Spearman correlation between pairwise distances in high-dimensional and low-dimensional spaces.
metrics.interpretation: Higher (close to 1) indicates global structure preservation

metrics.name: Local Quality (Q_local)
metrics.description: Average quality score for neighborhood preservation up to the optimal K_max threshold, derived from the co-ranking matrix.
metrics.interpretation: Higher indicates local neighborhood structure preservation

metrics.name: Global Quality (Q_global)
metrics.description: Average quality score for structure preservation beyond K_max threshold, measuring large-scale structure fidelity.

metrics.name: Local-Global Boundary (K_max)
metrics.description: The neighborhood size at which the Local Continuity Meta-Criterion (LCMC) is maximized.
metrics.interpretation: Larger K_max indicates the embedding preserves larger neighborhoods

evaluators.name: Clustering Metrics
evaluators.description: Clustering quality metrics computed on latent representations. Implemented in mixin.py _compute_metrics method.

metrics.name: Average Silhouette Width
metrics.description: Measures how similar each sample is to its own cluster compared to other clusters. Computed using sklearn.metrics.silhouette_score on latent representations.
metrics.interpretation: Higher indicates well-separated clusters. Values near 0 indicate overlapping clusters.

metrics.name: Calinski-Harabasz Index
metrics.description: Ratio of between-cluster dispersion to within-cluster dispersion. Also known as the Variance Ratio Criterion. Computed using sklearn.metrics.calinski_harabasz_score.
metrics.interpretation: Higher indicates denser and well-separated clusters.

metrics.name: Davies-Bouldin Index
metrics.description: Average similarity ratio of each cluster with its most similar cluster. Lower values indicate better clustering. Computed using sklearn.metrics.davies_bouldin_score.
metrics.interpretation: Lower indicates more compact and well-separated clusters.

metrics.name: Correlation Measure
metrics.description: Average absolute off-diagonal correlation between latent dimensions. Measures independence of learned latent factors. Computed via _calc_corr method in mixin.py.
metrics.interpretation: Lower indicates better disentanglement (more independent latent dimensions).
metrics.implementation: Mean of absolute off-diagonal entries of np.corrcoef(latent_representation.T)
